text: Be great in act, as you have been in thought.
author: William Shakespeare

text: When a true genius appears in this world, you may know him by this sign, that the dunces are all in confederacy against him.
author: Jonathan Swift)

text: I don’t know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve.
author: Tolkien J.R.R.

text: Now I have done what I can, he thought. Let him begin to circle and let the fight come.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: When they are preparing for war, those who rule by force speak most copiously about peace until they have completed the mobilization process.
author: Stefan Zweig

text: All the world is made of faith, and trust, and pixie dust.
author: James Matthew Barrie
